intro: Pseudopodospermum turkeviczii var. kubanica, commonly known as the Kuban sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant has a succulent, fleshy stem and leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Aizoaceae family.
